# Task

Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: â€œyyyymmâ€.



# Special Instructions

{{instructions}}

Here is the Julia solution for the problem you described. 

The function `add_yearmonth` takes a DataFrame and returns it with a new column `ym` that represents the year and month from `dt`.

```julia
using DataFrames, Dates

function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df[:ym] = map(x -> Dates.year(x)*100 + Dates.month(x), df.dt)
    return df
end
``` 
This function uses `map` from DataFrames package to apply a function to every element in the column `dt`. The anonymous function inside `map` extracts year and month from DateTime object using built-in functions of Dates module, converts them into integers, concatenate as `yyyymm`, and assign this value to the new column `ym`. 

Remember to ensure you have DataFrames.jl and Dates.jl packages installed in your Julia environment. You can install these using the Pkg REPL mode as follows:
```julia
using Pkg
pkg> add DataFrames
pkg> add Dates
```
